verses.verse: Now <WG3767> when Festus <WG5347> was come <WG1910> into the province <WG1885>, after <WG3326> three <WG5140> days <WG2250> he ascended <WG305> from <WG575> Caesarea <WG2542> to <WG1519> Jerusalem <WG2414>.
Then <WG1161> the high priest <WG749> and <WG2532> the chief <WG4413> of the Jews <WG2453> informed <WG1718> him <WG846> against <WG2596> Paul <WG3972>, and <WG2532> besought <WG3870> him <WG846>,

And desired <WG154> favour <WG5485> against <WG2596> him <WG846>, that <WG3704> he would send for <WG3343> him <WG846> to <WG1519> Jerusalem <WG2419>, laying <WG4160> wait <WG1747> in <WG2596> the way <WG3598> to kill <WG337> him <WG846>.

But <WG3303> <WG3767> Festus <WG5347> answered <WG611>, that Paul <WG3972> should be kept <WG5083> at <WG1722> Caesarea <WG2542>, and <WG1161> that he himself <WG1438> would <WG3195> depart <WG1607> <WG1722> shortly <WG5034> thither.

Let them therefore <WG3767>, said <WG5346> he, which among <WG1722> you <WG5213> are able <WG1415>, go down with <WG4782> me, and accuse <WG2723> this <WG846> man <WG435>, if <WG1536> there be <WG2076> any wickedness <WG1536> in <WG1722> him <WG5129>.

And <WG1161> when he had tarried <WG1304> among <WG1722> them <WG846> more <WG4119> than <WG2228> ten <WG1176> days <WG2250>, he went down <WG2597> unto <WG1519> Caesarea <WG2542>; and the next day <WG1887> sitting <WG2523> on <WG1909> the judgment seat <WG968> commanded <WG2753> Paul <WG3972> to be brought <WG71>.

And <WG1161> when he <WG846> was come <WG3854>, the Jews <WG2453> which came down <WG2597> from <WG575> Jerusalem <WG2414> stood round about <WG4026>, and <WG2532> laid <WG5342> many <WG4183> and grievous <WG926> complaints <WG157> against <WG2596> Paul <WG3972>, which <WG3739> they could <WG2480> not <WG3756> prove <WG584>.

While he answered <WG626> for himself <WG846>, Neither <WG3754> <WG3777> against <WG1519> the law <WG3551> of the Jews <WG2453>, neither <WG3777> against <WG1519> the temple <WG2411>, nor yet <WG3777> against <WG1519> Caesar <WG2541>, have I offended <WG264> any thing at all <WG5100>.

But <WG1161> Festus <WG5347>, willing <WG2309> to do <WG2698> the Jews <WG2453> a pleasure <WG5485>, answered <WG611> Paul <WG3972>, and said <WG2036>, Wilt thou <WG2309> go up <WG305> to <WG1519> Jerusalem <WG2414>, and there <WG1563> be judged <WG2919> of <WG4012> these things <WG5130> before <WG1909> me <WG1700>?

Then <WG1161> said <WG2036> Paul <WG3972>, I stand <WG1510> <WG2476> at <WG1909> Caesar's <WG2541> judgment seat <WG968>, where <WG3757> I <WG3165> ought <WG1163> to be judged <WG2919>: to the Jews <WG2453> have I done <WG91> no <WG3762> wrong <WG91>, as <WG5613> <WG2532> thou <WG4771> very well <WG2566> knowest <WG1921>.

For <WG1063> if <WG1487> <WG3303> I be an offender <WG91>, or <WG2532> have committed <WG4238> any thing <WG5100> worthy <WG514> of death <WG2288>, I refuse <WG3868> not <WG3756> to die <WG599>: but <WG1161> if <WG1487> there be <WG2076> none <WG3762> of these things <WG3739> whereof these <WG3778> accuse <WG2723> me <WG3450>, no man <WG3762> may <WG1410> deliver <WG5483> me <WG3165> unto them <WG846>. I appeal unto <WG1941> Caesar <WG2541>.

Then <WG5119> Festus <WG5347>, when he had conferred <WG4814> with <WG3326> the council <WG4824>, answered <WG611>, Hast thou appealed unto <WG1941> Caesar <WG2541>? unto <WG1909> Caesar <WG2541> shalt thou go <WG4198>.
And <WG1161> after <WG1230> certain <WG5100> days <WG2250> king <WG935> Agrippa <WG67> and <WG2532> Bernice <WG959> came <WG2658> unto <WG1519> Caesarea <WG2542> to salute <WG782> Festus <WG5347>.

And <WG1161> when <WG5613> they had been <WG1304> there <WG1563> many <WG4119> days <WG2250>, Festus <WG5347> declared <WG394> Paul's <WG3972> cause <WG2596> unto the king <WG935>, saying <WG3004>, There is <WG2076> a certain <WG5100> man <WG435> left <WG2641> in bonds <WG1198> by <WG5259> Felix <WG5344>:

About <WG4012> whom <WG3739>, when <WG1096> I <WG3450> was <WG1096> at <WG1519> Jerusalem <WG2414>, the chief priests <WG749> and <WG2532> the elders <WG4245> of the Jews <WG2453> informed <WG1718> me, desiring <WG154> to have judgment <WG1349> against <WG2596> him <WG846>.

To <WG4314> whom <WG3739> I answered <WG611> <WG3754>, It is <WG2076> not <WG3756> the manner <WG1485> of the Romans <WG4514> to deliver <WG5483> any <WG5100> man <WG444> to <WG1519> die <WG684>, before <WG4250> that <WG2228> he which is accused <WG2723> have <WG2192> the accusers <WG2725> face to face <WG2596> <WG4383> <WG5037>, and have <WG2983> licence <WG5117> to answer for himself <WG627> concerning <WG4012> the crime laid against him <WG1462>.

Therefore <WG3767>, when they <WG846> were come <WG4905> hither <WG1759>, without <WG4160> any <WG3367> delay <WG311> on the morrow <WG1836> I sat <WG2523> on <WG1909> the judgment seat <WG968>, and commanded <WG2753> the man <WG435> to be brought forth <WG71>.
Against <WG4012> whom <WG3739> when the accusers <WG2725> stood up <WG2476>, they brought <WG2018> none <WG3762> accusation <WG156> of such things as <WG3739> I <WG1473> supposed <WG5282>:

But <WG1161> had <WG2192> certain <WG5100> questions <WG2213> against <WG4314> him <WG846> of <WG4012> their own <WG2398> superstition <WG1175>, and <WG2532> of <WG4012> one <WG5100> Jesus <WG2424>, which was dead <WG2348>, whom <WG3739> Paul <WG3972> affirmed <WG5335> to be alive <WG2198>.

And <WG1161> because I <WG1473> doubted <WG639> of <WG1519> such <WG5127> manner <WG4012> of questions <WG2214>, I asked <WG3004> him whether <WG1487> he would <WG1014> go <WG4198> to <WG1519> Jerusalem <WG2419>, and there <WG2546> be judged <WG2919> of <WG4012> these matters <WG5130>.

But <WG1161> when Paul <WG3972> had appealed <WG1941> to be reserved <WG5083> <WG846> unto <WG1519> the hearing <WG1233> of Augustus <WG4575>, I commanded <WG2753> him <WG846> to be kept <WG5083> till <WG2193> <WG3739> I might send <WG3992> him <WG846> to <WG4314> Caesar <WG2541>.

Then <WG1161> Agrippa <WG67> said <WG5346> unto <WG4314> Festus <WG5347>, I would <WG1014> also <WG2532> hear <WG191> the man <WG444> myself <WG846>. To morrow <WG839> <WG1161>, said <WG5346> he, thou shalt hear <WG191> him <WG846>.

And on the morrow <WG1887>, when <WG3767> Agrippa <WG67> was come <WG2064>, and <WG2532> Bernice <WG959>, with <WG3326> great <WG4183> pomp <WG5325>, and <WG2532> was entered <WG1525> into <WG1519> the place of hearing <WG201>, with <WG4862> <WG5037> the chief captains <WG5506>, and <WG2532> principal <WG2596> <WG1851> men <WG435> of <WG5607> the city <WG4172>, at <WG2532> Festus' <WG5347> commandment <WG2753> Paul <WG3972> was brought forth <WG71>.

And <WG2532> Festus <WG5347> said <WG5346>, King <WG935> Agrippa <WG67>, and <WG2532> all <WG3956> men <WG435> which <WG3588> are here present <WG4840> with us <WG2254>, ye see <WG2334> this man <WG5126>, about <WG4012> whom <WG3739> all <WG3956> the multitude <WG4128> of the Jews <WG2453> have dealt <WG1793> with me <WG3427>, both <WG5037> at <WG1722> Jerusalem <WG2414>, and <WG2532> also here <WG1759>, crying <WG1916> that he ought <WG1163> not <WG3361> to live <WG2198> any longer <WG3371>.

But <WG1161> when I <WG1473> found <WG2638> that he <WG846> had committed <WG4238> nothing <WG3367> worthy <WG514> of death <WG2288>, and <WG2532> <WG1161> that he himself <WG846> hath appealed <WG5127> to <WG1941> Augustus <WG4575>, I have determined <WG2919> to send <WG3992> him <WG846>.

Of <WG4012> whom <WG3739> I have <WG2192> no <WG3756> certain <WG804> thing <WG5100> to write <WG1125> unto my lord <WG2962>. Wherefore <WG1352> I have brought <WG4254> him <WG846> forth <WG4254> before <WG1909> you <WG5216>, and <WG2532> specially <WG3122> before <WG1909> thee <WG4675>, O king <WG935> Agrippa <WG67>, that <WG3704>, after examination <WG351> had <WG1096>, I might have <WG2192> somewhat <WG5100> to write <WG1125>.

For <WG1063> it seemeth <WG1380> to me <WG3427> unreasonable <WG249> to send <WG3992> a prisoner <WG1198>, and <WG2532> not withal <WG3361> to signify <WG4591> the crimes <WG156> laid against <WG2596> him <WG846>.
